nodes.bodyText: This kind of test runs non-deterministically, not fix for unit tests. I don't think we have to cover concurrency in unit tests.
The thread pool execute multiple tasks concurrently, the execution order of concurrent runnable instructions is not deterministic.

The thread pool execute multiple tasks concurrently, the execution order of concurrent runnable instructions is not deterministic.

That's indeed the purpose of testing it. It should still work correctly. Without concurrency, the unit tests will be trivial.
That's why it's not necessary to test concurrency in unit tests. It won't deterministically catch a bug.
